... My plan is foiled!

text:
Huh, just found a bug in the `subtypetree` function:
because `Any <: Any == true`, you need to exclude it from the recursion:
```function subtypetree(root, level = 1, indent = 4)
    level == 1 && println(root)
    for s in subtypes(root)
    println(join(fill(" ", level * indent)) * string(s))
    if s != Any
        subtypetree(s, level = 1, indent)
    end
    end
end```

elements.text: Huh, just found a bug in the
subtypetree

function:
because
Any <: Any == true
, you need to exclude it from the recursion:

function subtypetree(root, level = 1, indent = 4)
    level == 1 && println(root)
    for s in subtypes(root)
    println(join(fill(" ", level * indent)) * string(s))
    if s != Any
        subtypetree(s, level = 1, indent)
    end
    end
end

text: I think it's the first book I'd give someone who has a couple weeks experience with Julia and needs it for a job / unbork their OOP brains quickly. I think it's very useful to have the mapping from mainstream OOP patterns and Julian patterns
